alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 2:45PM MST until February 22 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills ongoing. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow ongoing. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. * WHERE...Greeley, Fort Morgan, and Sterling. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 8 PM MST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. If you go outside, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Colorado can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by going to www.cotrip.org.
